text:
Hello!
We are in the process of integrating our customers using the *contacts APIs.* Is there a ready postman collection that we can download ?

<@USUKHCT2L> i think there is no official postman collection exists at this time, but there are example apps available and can help you - <https://github.com/HubSpot/integration-examples-php/tree/master/contacts-app>
hot from the press: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs-beta/crm/search>
thanks <@UDU6KEBFB> -- hope eveyrthing is going good for you!
all is fine. thanks for asking
Thanks <@UCH1L597V>

Asking for a friend: how big of a problem would it be if someone were to build apps that work with non-documented HubSpot APIs?

i.e. <https://api.hubapi.com/content/api/v4/custom-widgets/> , <https://api.HubSpot.com/cosindex/api/v1/connections/>
Hey <@U54TVT3C1> It would be a pretty big problem.  It’s almost guaranteed to break in the near future
Can you tell me more about what you are looking to accomplish overall? I want to see if we can solve this officially, or at least work towards an official solution

Good to know.  Managed to put something fairly simple together that’s really for one time use.

So, here was my use case:

I’m currently putting together a report on all of the modules that we use to build our site.  As part of that report, I am including links to all dependent pages for the modules.

This is to give us a better idea of which modules are heavily used, which ones can be merged, and which ones are completely unneccessary.
In future, I was thinking to build an app that would get all that info, and then push it to a HubDB that I use for internal use only page that shows all active modules and their locations
awesome, I’m gonna add that to our internal idea tracker and start some conversations with the cms team to see if this something we can support for you
Sweet.  Thanks Zack!  Not exactly the most common activity, but I could see this being a great tool for agency devs who are taking over portals/sites built by other agencies

Closely related thread: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1579275197001900>

tl;dr I actually am looking to build this kind of an app as an example on how to use our CMS APIs
<@U25PYL3Q8> is the friend I was asking for
lol
I believe this is a need to know basis, so Ian doesn't need to know

Full disclosure: I know very little node, so I came up with an idea, and managed to put something super janky together that did what I needed.  Nick was interested in making something more finished with it
yeah I think it is pretty awesome..

Hello friends, 

If I have form in local html then can I submit HubSpot form with API?
you mean from your localhost ?
